Description: Part of a painted limestone stela; list of offerings in six columns of painted hieroglyphs; two raised borders at either side; blackened by smoke.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Fits the description of a broken painted stela found in the shaft of Tomb V, according to Hogarth's notes.
Bibliographic references: Ryan 1988 / The Archaeological Excavations of David George Hogarth at Asyut, Egypt 1906/7 (16)
